item.title: Piecewise linear trends
item.description: I prepared the following notes for a consulting client, and I thought they might be of interest to some other people too. Let \(y_t\) denote the value of the time series at time \(t\), and suppose we wish to fit a trend with correlated errors of the form \[ y_t = f(t) + n_t, \] where \(f(t)\) represents the possibly nonlinear trend and \(n_t\) is an autocorrelated error process.
